newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Andean Devel. Corp grants $205.5 mln in credits.
newsitem.headline: Andean Devel. Corp grants $205.5 mln in credits.

text.p: The Andean Development Corp (CAF) said Monday it approved credits totaling $205.5 million to Bolivia, Ecuador and Peru.

The CAF, which is the financial arm of the Andean group of countries, said in a statement it had increased the size of a loan to Compania Boliviana de Energia Electrica to $50 million in order to develop electricity generation for Bolivia's capital, La Paz.
Ecuador was granted a 10-year $70 million loan to develop the road network in the town of Quayaquil.

The CAF also approved a $55.5 million credit to strengthen Peru's Financial Corporation of Development. In addition, the Andean financing institution gave Peru's private sector Banco Wiese a $30 million loan to promote foreign trade.
The CAF finances public and private sector projects in the member countries.
The Andean group is made up of Bolivia, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru and Venezuela but the CAF membership extends to Brazil, Chile, Mexico and Trinidad and Tobago who are not Andean members.
In 1996, the CAF had a portfolio of loans and investments worth $2.73 billion.
